com.io7m.r2.core

Interface R2ShadowDepthVarianceType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    R2ShadowType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    R2ShadowDepthVariance

    public interface R2ShadowDepthVarianceType
extends R2ShadowType
    The type of depth variance shadows.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • shadowID

        long shadowID()
        Specified by:
        shadowID in interface R2ShadowType
        Returns:
        The unique shadow ID

      • minimumFactor

        default float minimumFactor()
        Description copied from interface: R2ShadowType
        The level to which the shadow is allowed to attenuate light. A value of n means that if a point is in shadow, the light intensity will be attenuated down to n.
        Specified by:
        minimumFactor in interface R2ShadowType
        Returns:
        The minimum shadow factor

      • mapDescription

        R2DepthVarianceBufferDescription mapDescription()
        Returns:
        The shadow map description

      • lightBleedReduction

        default float lightBleedReduction()

        The amount of light bleed reduction to apply.

        This is a scene-dependent value that effectively darkens shadows in order to eliminate "light bleeding" (where light appears to bleed through occluding objects). Setting this value too high results in a loss of detail for shadows.

        Returns:
        The amount of light bleed reduction

      • minimumVariance

        default float minimumVariance()

        The the minimum variance value for the shadow.

        The value is used to eliminate biasing issues in shadows. The default value is sufficient for almost all scenes.

        Returns:
        The amount of light bleed reduction

                                                com.io7m.jfunctional.PartialBiFunctionType<A,R2ShadowDepthVarianceType,B,E> on_variance)
                                         throws E extends Throwable
